titlepage.titleproper: Inventory for the Clifford B. Jones Papers, 1814-1973 and undated,
titlepage.author: Abel Ramirez

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Clifford Bartlett Jones Papers, 1814-1973 and undated
did.abstract: Papers of Clifford B. Jones, third President of Texas Technological College, from 1814-1973 and undated.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: Clifford Bartlett Jones was born in Rico, Colorado, in 1886 and came to Texas to work with his father on S. M. Swenson's Spur Ranch in 1907. Jones supervised the dispersal and sale of the ranch property from 1913 to 1939. He served as mayor and president of the Chamber of Commerce of Spur. In 1939 he became the third President of Texas Technological College and served in this position until resigning in 1944 due to poor health. Jones was a civic and business leader in West Texas.

From 1936-1939 he had also served as president and board chairman of the Spur Security Bank, in which he maintained controlling interest until 1962. He was also director of the Mercantile National Bank in Dallas and became director and chairman of the board of the Lubbock National Bank in 1944. Jones held numerous other administrative positions, including being director of the Southwestern Public Service Company, life insurance and motor companies, several railroad companies, and serving as the third president of the West Texas Chamber of Commerce and vice president of the Texas Highway Association. The football stadium at Texas Tech University was established through a trust fund set up by Jones and in 1947 the stadium was dedicated as Jones Stadium.
The Handbook of Texas has published a more in-depth online biography of Clifford B. Jones at http://www.tsha.utexas.edu/handbook/online/search.html

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, legal material, financial material, photographs, genealogical material and news clippings relating to the business, educational and personal activities of Clifford B. Jones.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: The subject headings used by the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library are derived from the Library of Congress and/or locally developed.

controlaccess.head: Subjects (Organizations)
controlaccess.corpname: S. M. Swenson & Sons (New York, N.Y.)

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Clifford B. Jones Papers, 1814-1973 and undated, Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University

bibliography.head: Additional Sources
bibliography.bibref: Guy, Charles A. A history of the First 59 Years of Lubbock National Bank, 1917-1975. Lubbock, Tex.: Lubbock National Bank, 1976.
